00067 /* *********************** NOTE ON POSE AND ACTION **********************
00068  *
00069  * - Pose is the local (object level) component of armature. The current
00070  *   object pose is saved in files, and (will be) is presorted for dependency
00071  * - Actions have fewer (or other) channels, and write data to a Pose
00072  * - Currently ob->pose data is controlled in where_is_pose only. The (recalc)
00073  *   event system takes care of calling that
00074  * - The NLA system (here too) uses Poses as interpolation format for Actions
00075  * - Therefore we assume poses to be static, and duplicates of poses have channels in
00076  *   same order, for quick interpolation reasons
00077  *
00078  * ****************************** (ton) ************************************ */
00079 
00080 /* ***************** Library data level operations on action ************** */
00081 
00082 bAction *add_empty_action(const char name[])
00083 {
00084     bAction *act;
00085     
00086     act= alloc_libblock(&G.main->action, ID_AC, name);
00087     
00088     return act;
00089 }

00093 /* temp data for make_local_action */
00094 typedef struct tMakeLocalActionContext {
00095     bAction *act;       /* original action */
00096     bAction *act_new;   /* new action */
00097     
00098     int is_lib;         /* some action users were libraries */
00099     int is_local;       /* some action users were not libraries */
00100 } tMakeLocalActionContext;
00101 
00102 /* helper function for make_local_action() - local/lib init step */
00103 static void make_localact_init_cb(ID *id, AnimData *adt, void *mlac_ptr)
00104 {
00105     tMakeLocalActionContext *mlac = (tMakeLocalActionContext *)mlac_ptr;
00106     
00107     if (adt->action == mlac->act) {
00108         if (id->lib) mlac->is_lib= TRUE;
00109         else mlac->is_local= TRUE;
00110     }
00111 }
00112 
00113 /* helper function for make_local_action() - change references */
00114 static void make_localact_apply_cb(ID *id, AnimData *adt, void *mlac_ptr)
00115 {
00116     tMakeLocalActionContext *mlac = (tMakeLocalActionContext *)mlac_ptr;
00117     
00118     if (adt->action == mlac->act) {
00119         if (id->lib == NULL) {
00120             adt->action = mlac->act_new;
00121             
00122             id_us_plus(&mlac->act_new->id);
00123             id_us_min(&mlac->act->id);
00124         }
00125     }
00126 }
00127 
00128 // does copy_fcurve...
00129 void make_local_action(bAction *act)
00130 {
00131     tMakeLocalActionContext mlac = {act, NULL, FALSE, FALSE};
00132     Main *bmain= G.main;
00133     
00134     if (act->id.lib==NULL) 
00135         return;
00136     
00137     // XXX: double-check this; it used to be just single-user check, but that was when fake-users were still default
00138     if ((act->id.flag & LIB_FAKEUSER) && (act->id.us<=1)) {
00139         id_clear_lib_data(bmain, &act->id);
00140         return;
00141     }
00142     
00143     BKE_animdata_main_cb(bmain, make_localact_init_cb, &mlac);
00144     
00145     if (mlac.is_local && mlac.is_lib==FALSE) {
00146         id_clear_lib_data(bmain, &act->id);
00147     }
00148     else if (mlac.is_local && mlac.is_lib) {
00149         mlac.act_new= copy_action(act);
00150         mlac.act_new->id.us= 0;
00151 
00152         BKE_id_lib_local_paths(bmain, act->id.lib, &mlac.act_new->id);
00153 
00154         BKE_animdata_main_cb(bmain, make_localact_apply_cb, &mlac);
00155     }
00156 }

00160 void free_action (bAction *act)
00161 {
00162     /* sanity check */
00163     if (act == NULL)
00164         return;
00165     
00166     /* Free F-Curves */
00167     free_fcurves(&act->curves);
00168     
00169     /* Free groups */
00170     if (act->groups.first)
00171         BLI_freelistN(&act->groups);
00172         
00173     /* Free pose-references (aka local markers) */
00174     if (act->markers.first)
00175         BLI_freelistN(&act->markers);
00176 }

00178 /* .................................. */
00179 
00180 bAction *copy_action (bAction *src)
00181 {
00182     bAction *dst = NULL;
00183     bActionGroup *dgrp, *sgrp;
00184     FCurve *dfcu, *sfcu;
00185     
00186     if (src == NULL) 
00187         return NULL;
00188     dst= copy_libblock(&src->id);
00189     
00190     /* duplicate the lists of groups and markers */
00191     BLI_duplicatelist(&dst->groups, &src->groups);
00192     BLI_duplicatelist(&dst->markers, &src->markers);
00193     
00194     /* copy F-Curves, fixing up the links as we go */
00195     dst->curves.first= dst->curves.last= NULL;
00196     
00197     for (sfcu= src->curves.first; sfcu; sfcu= sfcu->next) {
00198         /* duplicate F-Curve */
00199         dfcu= copy_fcurve(sfcu);
00200         BLI_addtail(&dst->curves, dfcu);
00201         
00202         /* fix group links (kindof bad list-in-list search, but this is the most reliable way) */
00203         for (dgrp=dst->groups.first, sgrp=src->groups.first; dgrp && sgrp; dgrp=dgrp->next, sgrp=sgrp->next) {
00204             if (sfcu->grp == sgrp) {
00205                 dfcu->grp= dgrp;
00206                 
00207                 if (dgrp->channels.first == sfcu)
00208                     dgrp->channels.first= dfcu;
00209                 if (dgrp->channels.last == sfcu)
00210                     dgrp->channels.last= dfcu;
00211                     
00212                 break;
00213             }
00214         }
00215     }
00216     
00217     return dst;
00218 }

00222 /* Get the active action-group for an Action */
00223 bActionGroup *get_active_actiongroup (bAction *act)
00224 {
00225     bActionGroup *agrp= NULL;
00226     
00227     if (act && act->groups.first) { 
00228         for (agrp= act->groups.first; agrp; agrp= agrp->next) {
00229             if (agrp->flag & AGRP_ACTIVE)
00230                 break;
00231         }
00232     }
00233     
00234     return agrp;
00235 }
00236 
00237 /* Make the given Action-Group the active one */
00238 void set_active_action_group (bAction *act, bActionGroup *agrp, short select)
00239 {
00240     bActionGroup *grp;
00241     
00242     /* sanity checks */
00243     if (act == NULL)
00244         return;
00245     
00246     /* Deactive all others */
00247     for (grp= act->groups.first; grp; grp= grp->next) {
00248         if ((grp==agrp) && (select))
00249             grp->flag |= AGRP_ACTIVE;
00250         else    
00251             grp->flag &= ~AGRP_ACTIVE;
00252     }
00253 }
00254 
00255 /* Add a new action group with the given name to the action */
00256 bActionGroup *action_groups_add_new (bAction *act, const char name[])
00257 {
00258     bActionGroup *agrp;
00259     
00260     /* sanity check: must have action and name */
00261     if (ELEM(NULL, act, name))
00262         return NULL;
00263     
00264     /* allocate a new one */
00265     agrp = MEM_callocN(sizeof(bActionGroup), "bActionGroup");
00266     
00267     /* make it selected, with default name */
00268     agrp->flag = AGRP_SELECTED;
00269     BLI_strncpy(agrp->name, name[0] ? name : "Group", sizeof(agrp->name));
00270     
00271     /* add to action, and validate */
00272     BLI_addtail(&act->groups, agrp);
00273     BLI_uniquename(&act->groups, agrp, "Group", '.', offsetof(bActionGroup, name), sizeof(agrp->name)); 
00274     
00275     /* return the new group */
00276     return agrp;
00277 }
00278 
00279 /* Add given channel into (active) group 
00280  *  - assumes that channel is not linked to anything anymore
00281  *  - always adds at the end of the group 
00282  */
00283 void action_groups_add_channel (bAction *act, bActionGroup *agrp, FCurve *fcurve)
00284 {   
00285     /* sanity checks */
00286     if (ELEM3(NULL, act, agrp, fcurve))
00287         return;
00288     
00289     /* if no channels anywhere, just add to two lists at the same time */
00290     if (act->curves.first == NULL) {
00291         fcurve->next = fcurve->prev = NULL;
00292         
00293         agrp->channels.first = agrp->channels.last = fcurve;
00294         act->curves.first = act->curves.last = fcurve;
00295     }
00296     
00297     /* if the group already has channels, the F-Curve can simply be added to the list 
00298      * (i.e. as the last channel in the group)
00299      */
00300     else if (agrp->channels.first) {
00301         /* if the group's last F-Curve is the action's last F-Curve too, 
00302          * then set the F-Curve as the last for the action first so that
00303          * the lists will be in sync after linking
00304          */
00305         if (agrp->channels.last == act->curves.last)
00306             act->curves.last= fcurve;
00307             
00308         /* link in the given F-Curve after the last F-Curve in the group,
00309          * which means that it should be able to fit in with the rest of the
00310          * list seamlessly
00311          */
00312         BLI_insertlinkafter(&agrp->channels, agrp->channels.last, fcurve);
00313     }
00314     
00315     /* otherwise, need to find the nearest F-Curve in group before/after current to link with */
00316     else {
00317         bActionGroup *grp;
00318         
00319         /* firstly, link this F-Curve to the group */
00320         agrp->channels.first = agrp->channels.last = fcurve;
00321         
00322         /* step through the groups preceding this one, finding the F-Curve there to attach this one after */
00323         for (grp= agrp->prev; grp; grp= grp->prev) {
00324             /* if this group has F-Curves, we want weave the given one in right after the last channel there,
00325              * but via the Action's list not this group's list
00326              *  - this is so that the F-Curve is in the right place in the Action,
00327              *    but won't be included in the previous group
00328              */
00329             if (grp->channels.last) {
00330                 /* once we've added, break here since we don't need to search any further... */
00331                 BLI_insertlinkafter(&act->curves, grp->channels.last, fcurve);
00332                 break;
00333             }
00334         }
00335         
00336         /* if grp is NULL, that means we fell through, and this F-Curve should be added as the new first
00337          * since group is (effectively) the first group. Thus, the existing first F-Curve becomes the 
00338          * second in the chain, etc. etc.
00339          */
00340         if (grp == NULL)
00341             BLI_insertlinkbefore(&act->curves, act->curves.first, fcurve);
00342     }
00343     
00344     /* set the F-Curve's new group */
00345     fcurve->grp= agrp;
00346 }   
00347 
00348 /* Remove the given channel from all groups */
00349 void action_groups_remove_channel (bAction *act, FCurve *fcu)
00350 {
00351     /* sanity checks */
00352     if (ELEM(NULL, act, fcu))   
00353         return;
00354     
00355     /* check if any group used this directly */
00356     if (fcu->grp) {
00357         bActionGroup *agrp= fcu->grp;
00358         
00359         if (agrp->channels.first == agrp->channels.last) {
00360             if (agrp->channels.first == fcu) {
00361                 agrp->channels.first= NULL;
00362                 agrp->channels.last= NULL;
00363             }
00364         }
00365         else if (agrp->channels.first == fcu) {
00366             if ((fcu->next) && (fcu->next->grp==agrp))
00367                 agrp->channels.first= fcu->next;
00368             else
00369                 agrp->channels.first= NULL;
00370         }
00371         else if (agrp->channels.last == fcu) {
00372             if ((fcu->prev) && (fcu->prev->grp==agrp))
00373                 agrp->channels.last= fcu->prev;
00374             else
00375                 agrp->channels.last= NULL;
00376         }
00377         
00378         fcu->grp= NULL;
00379     }
00380     
00381     /* now just remove from list */
00382     BLI_remlink(&act->curves, fcu);
00383 }

00385 /* Find a group with the given name */
00386 bActionGroup *action_groups_find_named (bAction *act, const char name[])
00387 {
00388     /* sanity checks */
00389     if (ELEM3(NULL, act, act->groups.first, name) || (name[0] == 0))
00390         return NULL;
00391         
00392     /* do string comparisons */
00393     return BLI_findstring(&act->groups, name, offsetof(bActionGroup, name));
00394 }
00395 
00396 /* Clear all 'temp' flags on all groups */
00397 void action_groups_clear_tempflags (bAction *act)
00398 {
00399     bActionGroup *agrp;
00400     
00401     /* sanity checks */
00402     if (ELEM(NULL, act, act->groups.first))
00403         return;
00404         
00405     /* flag clearing loop */
00406     for (agrp = act->groups.first; agrp; agrp = agrp->next)
00407         agrp->flag &= ~AGRP_TEMP;
00408 }

00410 /* *************** Pose channels *************** */
00411 
00412 /* usually used within a loop, so we got a N^2 slowdown */
00413 bPoseChannel *get_pose_channel(const bPose *pose, const char *name)
00414 {
00415     if (ELEM(NULL, pose, name) || (name[0] == 0))
00416         return NULL;
00417     
00418     if (pose->chanhash)
00419         return BLI_ghash_lookup(pose->chanhash, (void *)name);
00420     
00421     return BLI_findstring(&((bPose *)pose)->chanbase, name, offsetof(bPoseChannel, name));
00422 }
00423 
00424 /* Use with care, not on Armature poses but for temporal ones */
00425 /* (currently used for action constraints and in rebuild_pose) */
00426 bPoseChannel *verify_pose_channel(bPose *pose, const char *name)
00427 {
00428     bPoseChannel *chan;
00429     
00430     if (pose == NULL)
00431         return NULL;
00432     
00433     /* See if this channel exists */
00434     chan= BLI_findstring(&pose->chanbase, name, offsetof(bPoseChannel, name));
00435     if (chan) {
00436         return chan;
00437     }
00438 
00439     /* If not, create it and add it */
00440     chan = MEM_callocN(sizeof(bPoseChannel), "verifyPoseChannel");
00441     
00442     BLI_strncpy(chan->name, name, sizeof(chan->name));
00443     /* init vars to prevent math errors */
00444     unit_qt(chan->quat);
00445     unit_axis_angle(chan->rotAxis, &chan->rotAngle);
00446     chan->size[0] = chan->size[1] = chan->size[2] = 1.0f;
00447     
00448     chan->limitmin[0]= chan->limitmin[1]= chan->limitmin[2]= -180.0f;
00449     chan->limitmax[0]= chan->limitmax[1]= chan->limitmax[2]= 180.0f;
00450     chan->stiffness[0]= chan->stiffness[1]= chan->stiffness[2]= 0.0f;
00451     chan->ikrotweight = chan->iklinweight = 0.0f;
00452     unit_m4(chan->constinv);
00453     
00454     chan->protectflag = OB_LOCK_ROT4D;  /* lock by components by default */
00455     
00456     BLI_addtail(&pose->chanbase, chan);
00457     free_pose_channels_hash(pose);
00458     
00459     return chan;
00460 }
00461 
00462 /* Find the active posechannel for an object (we can't just use pose, as layer info is in armature) */
00463 bPoseChannel *get_active_posechannel (Object *ob)
00464 {
00465     bArmature *arm= (ob) ? ob->data : NULL;
00466     bPoseChannel *pchan;
00467 
00468     if (ELEM3(NULL, ob, ob->pose, arm)) {
00469         return NULL;
00470     }
00471 
00472     /* find active */
00473     for (pchan= ob->pose->chanbase.first; pchan; pchan= pchan->next) {
00474         if ((pchan->bone) && (pchan->bone == arm->act_bone) && (pchan->bone->layer & arm->layer))
00475             return pchan;
00476     }
00477     
00478     return NULL;
00479 }

00481 const char *get_ikparam_name(bPose *pose)
00482 {
00483     if (pose) {
00484         switch (pose->iksolver) {
00485         case IKSOLVER_LEGACY:
00486             return NULL;
00487         case IKSOLVER_ITASC:
00488             return "bItasc";
00489         }
00490     }
00491     return NULL;
00492 }
00493 /* dst should be freed already, makes entire duplicate */
00494 void copy_pose (bPose **dst, bPose *src, int copycon)
00495 {
00496     bPose *outPose;
00497     bPoseChannel *pchan;
00498     ListBase listb;
00499     
00500     if (!src) {
00501         *dst=NULL;
00502         return;
00503     }
00504     
00505     if (*dst==src) {
00506         printf("copy_pose source and target are the same\n");
00507         *dst=NULL;
00508         return;
00509     }
00510     
00511     outPose= MEM_callocN(sizeof(bPose), "pose");
00512     
00513     BLI_duplicatelist(&outPose->chanbase, &src->chanbase);
00514     
00515     outPose->iksolver = src->iksolver;
00516     outPose->ikdata = NULL;
00517     outPose->ikparam = MEM_dupallocN(src->ikparam);
00518     
00519     for (pchan=outPose->chanbase.first; pchan; pchan=pchan->next) {
00520         // TODO: rename this argument...
00521         if (copycon) {
00522             copy_constraints(&listb, &pchan->constraints, TRUE);  // copy_constraints NULLs listb
00523             pchan->constraints= listb;
00524             pchan->mpath= NULL; /* motion paths should not get copied yet... */
00525         }
00526         
00527         if (pchan->prop) {
00528             pchan->prop= IDP_CopyProperty(pchan->prop);
00529         }
00530     }
00531 
00532     /* for now, duplicate Bone Groups too when doing this */
00533     if (copycon)
00534         BLI_duplicatelist(&outPose->agroups, &src->agroups);
00535     
00536     *dst=outPose;
00537 }
00538 
00539 void init_pose_itasc(bItasc *itasc)
00540 {
00541     if (itasc) {
00542         itasc->iksolver = IKSOLVER_ITASC;
00543         itasc->minstep = 0.01f;
00544         itasc->maxstep = 0.06f;
00545         itasc->numiter = 100;
00546         itasc->numstep = 4;
00547         itasc->precision = 0.005f;
00548         itasc->flag = ITASC_AUTO_STEP|ITASC_INITIAL_REITERATION;
00549         itasc->feedback = 20.0f;
00550         itasc->maxvel = 50.0f;
00551         itasc->solver = ITASC_SOLVER_SDLS;
00552         itasc->dampmax = 0.5;
00553         itasc->dampeps = 0.15;
00554     }
00555 }
00556 void init_pose_ikparam(bPose *pose)
00557 {
00558     bItasc *itasc;
00559     switch (pose->iksolver) {
00560     case IKSOLVER_ITASC:
00561         itasc = MEM_callocN(sizeof(bItasc), "itasc");
00562         init_pose_itasc(itasc);
00563         pose->ikparam = itasc;
00564         break;
00565     case IKSOLVER_LEGACY:
00566     default:
00567         pose->ikparam = NULL;
00568         break;
00569     }
00570 }
00571 
00572 void make_pose_channels_hash(bPose *pose) 
00573 {
00574     if (!pose->chanhash) {
00575         bPoseChannel *pchan;
00576 
00577         pose->chanhash= BLI_ghash_new(BLI_ghashutil_strhash, BLI_ghashutil_strcmp, "make_pose_chan gh");
00578         for (pchan=pose->chanbase.first; pchan; pchan=pchan->next)
00579             BLI_ghash_insert(pose->chanhash, pchan->name, pchan);
00580     }
00581 }
00582 
00583 void free_pose_channels_hash(bPose *pose) 
00584 {
00585     if (pose->chanhash) {
00586         BLI_ghash_free(pose->chanhash, NULL, NULL);
00587         pose->chanhash= NULL;
00588     }
00589 }

00591 
00592 void free_pose_channel(bPoseChannel *pchan)
00593 {
00594 
00595     if (pchan->mpath) {
00596         animviz_free_motionpath(pchan->mpath);
00597         pchan->mpath= NULL;
00598     }
00599 
00600     free_constraints(&pchan->constraints);
00601     
00602     if (pchan->prop) {
00603         IDP_FreeProperty(pchan->prop);
00604         MEM_freeN(pchan->prop);
00605     }
00606 }
00607 
00608 void free_pose_channels(bPose *pose) 
00609 {
00610     bPoseChannel *pchan;
00611     
00612     if (pose->chanbase.first) {
00613         for (pchan = pose->chanbase.first; pchan; pchan=pchan->next)
00614             free_pose_channel(pchan);
00615         
00616         BLI_freelistN(&pose->chanbase);
00617     }
00618 
00619     free_pose_channels_hash(pose);
00620 }
00621 
00622 void free_pose(bPose *pose)
00623 {
00624     if (pose) {
00625         /* free pose-channels */
00626         free_pose_channels(pose);
00627         
00628         /* free pose-groups */
00629         if (pose->agroups.first)
00630             BLI_freelistN(&pose->agroups);
00631         
00632         /* free IK solver state */
00633         BIK_clear_data(pose);
00634         
00635         /* free IK solver param */
00636         if (pose->ikparam)
00637             MEM_freeN(pose->ikparam);
00638         
00639         /* free pose */
00640         MEM_freeN(pose);
00641     }
00642 }
00643 
00644 static void copy_pose_channel_data(bPoseChannel *pchan, const bPoseChannel *chan)
00645 {
00646     bConstraint *pcon, *con;
00647     
00648     copy_v3_v3(pchan->loc, chan->loc);
00649     copy_v3_v3(pchan->size, chan->size);
00650     copy_v3_v3(pchan->eul, chan->eul);
00651     copy_v3_v3(pchan->rotAxis, chan->rotAxis);
00652     pchan->rotAngle= chan->rotAngle;
00653     copy_qt_qt(pchan->quat, chan->quat);
00654     pchan->rotmode= chan->rotmode;
00655     copy_m4_m4(pchan->chan_mat, (float(*)[4])chan->chan_mat);
00656     copy_m4_m4(pchan->pose_mat, (float(*)[4])chan->pose_mat);
00657     pchan->flag= chan->flag;
00658     
00659     con= chan->constraints.first;
00660     for (pcon= pchan->constraints.first; pcon && con; pcon= pcon->next, con= con->next) {
00661         pcon->enforce= con->enforce;
00662         pcon->headtail= con->headtail;
00663     }
00664 }
00665 
00666 /* makes copies of internal data, unlike copy_pose_channel_data which only
00667  * copies the pose state.
00668  * hint: use when copying bones in editmode (on returned value from verify_pose_channel) */
00669 void duplicate_pose_channel_data(bPoseChannel *pchan, const bPoseChannel *pchan_from)
00670 {
00671     /* copy transform locks */
00672     pchan->protectflag = pchan_from->protectflag;
00673 
00674     /* copy rotation mode */
00675     pchan->rotmode = pchan_from->rotmode;
00676 
00677     /* copy bone group */
00678     pchan->agrp_index= pchan_from->agrp_index;
00679 
00680     /* ik (dof) settings */
00681     pchan->ikflag = pchan_from->ikflag;
00682     copy_v3_v3(pchan->limitmin, pchan_from->limitmin);
00683     copy_v3_v3(pchan->limitmax, pchan_from->limitmax);
00684     copy_v3_v3(pchan->stiffness, pchan_from->stiffness);
00685     pchan->ikstretch= pchan_from->ikstretch;
00686     pchan->ikrotweight= pchan_from->ikrotweight;
00687     pchan->iklinweight= pchan_from->iklinweight;
00688 
00689     /* constraints */
00690     copy_constraints(&pchan->constraints, &pchan_from->constraints, TRUE);
00691 
00692     /* id-properties */
00693     if (pchan->prop) {
00694         /* unlikely but possible it exists */
00695         IDP_FreeProperty(pchan->prop);
00696         MEM_freeN(pchan->prop);
00697         pchan->prop= NULL;
00698     }
00699     if (pchan_from->prop) {
00700         pchan->prop= IDP_CopyProperty(pchan_from->prop);
00701     }
00702 
00703     /* custom shape */
00704     pchan->custom= pchan_from->custom;
00705 }
00706 
00707 
00708 /* checks for IK constraint, Spline IK, and also for Follow-Path constraint.
00709  * can do more constraints flags later 
00710  */
00711 /* pose should be entirely OK */
00712 void update_pose_constraint_flags(bPose *pose)
00713 {
00714     bPoseChannel *pchan, *parchan;
00715     bConstraint *con;
00716     
00717     /* clear */
00718     for (pchan= pose->chanbase.first; pchan; pchan= pchan->next) {
00719         pchan->constflag= 0;
00720     }
00721     pose->flag &= ~POSE_CONSTRAINTS_TIMEDEPEND;
00722     
00723     /* detect */
00724     for (pchan= pose->chanbase.first; pchan; pchan=pchan->next) {
00725         for (con= pchan->constraints.first; con; con= con->next) {
00726             if (con->type==CONSTRAINT_TYPE_KINEMATIC) {
00727                 bKinematicConstraint *data = (bKinematicConstraint*)con->data;
00728                 
00729                 pchan->constflag |= PCHAN_HAS_IK;
00730                 
00731                 if (data->tar==NULL || (data->tar->type==OB_ARMATURE && data->subtarget[0]==0))
00732                     pchan->constflag |= PCHAN_HAS_TARGET;
00733                 
00734                 /* negative rootbone = recalc rootbone index. used in do_versions */
00735                 if (data->rootbone<0) {
00736                     data->rootbone= 0;
00737                     
00738                     if (data->flag & CONSTRAINT_IK_TIP) parchan= pchan;
00739                     else parchan= pchan->parent;
00740                     
00741                     while (parchan) {
00742                         data->rootbone++;
00743                         if ((parchan->bone->flag & BONE_CONNECTED)==0)
00744                             break;
00745                         parchan= parchan->parent;
00746                     }
00747                 }
00748             }
00749             else if (con->type == CONSTRAINT_TYPE_FOLLOWPATH) {
00750                 bFollowPathConstraint *data= (bFollowPathConstraint *)con->data;
00751                 
00752                 /* for drawing constraint colors when color set allows this */
00753                 pchan->constflag |= PCHAN_HAS_CONST;
00754                 
00755                 /* if we have a valid target, make sure that this will get updated on frame-change
00756                  * (needed for when there is no anim-data for this pose)
00757                  */
00758                 if ((data->tar) && (data->tar->type==OB_CURVE))
00759                     pose->flag |= POSE_CONSTRAINTS_TIMEDEPEND;
00760             }
00761             else if (con->type == CONSTRAINT_TYPE_SPLINEIK)
00762                 pchan->constflag |= PCHAN_HAS_SPLINEIK;
00763             else 
00764                 pchan->constflag |= PCHAN_HAS_CONST;
00765         }
00766     }
00767 }
00768 
00769 /* Clears all BONE_UNKEYED flags for every pose channel in every pose 
00770  * This should only be called on frame changing, when it is acceptable to
00771  * do this. Otherwise, these flags should not get cleared as poses may get lost.
00772  */
00773 void framechange_poses_clear_unkeyed(void)
00774 {
00775     Object *ob;
00776     bPose *pose;
00777     bPoseChannel *pchan;
00778     
00779     /* This needs to be done for each object that has a pose */
00780     // TODO: proxies may/may not be correctly handled here... (this needs checking) 
00781     for (ob= G.main->object.first; ob; ob= ob->id.next) {
00782         /* we only need to do this on objects with a pose */
00783         if ( (pose= ob->pose) ) {
00784             for (pchan= pose->chanbase.first; pchan; pchan= pchan->next) {
00785                 if (pchan->bone) 
00786                     pchan->bone->flag &= ~BONE_UNKEYED;
00787             }
00788         }
00789     }
00790 }
00791 
00792 /* ************************** Bone Groups ************************** */
00793 
00794 /* Adds a new bone-group */
00795 void pose_add_group (Object *ob)
00796 {
00797     bPose *pose= (ob) ? ob->pose : NULL;
00798     bActionGroup *grp;
00799     
00800     if (ELEM(NULL, ob, ob->pose))
00801         return;
00802     
00803     grp= MEM_callocN(sizeof(bActionGroup), "PoseGroup");
00804     BLI_strncpy(grp->name, "Group", sizeof(grp->name));
00805     BLI_addtail(&pose->agroups, grp);
00806     BLI_uniquename(&pose->agroups, grp, "Group", '.', offsetof(bActionGroup, name), sizeof(grp->name));
00807     
00808     pose->active_group= BLI_countlist(&pose->agroups);
00809 }
00810 
00811 /* Remove the active bone-group */
00812 void pose_remove_group (Object *ob)
00813 {
00814     bPose *pose= (ob) ? ob->pose : NULL;
00815     bActionGroup *grp = NULL;
00816     bPoseChannel *pchan;
00817     
00818     /* sanity checks */
00819     if (ELEM(NULL, ob, pose))
00820         return;
00821     if (pose->active_group <= 0)
00822         return;
00823     
00824     /* get group to remove */
00825     grp= BLI_findlink(&pose->agroups, pose->active_group-1);
00826     if (grp) {
00827         /* adjust group references (the trouble of using indices!):
00828          *  - firstly, make sure nothing references it 
00829          *  - also, make sure that those after this item get corrected
00830          */
00831         for (pchan= pose->chanbase.first; pchan; pchan= pchan->next) {
00832             if (pchan->agrp_index == pose->active_group)
00833                 pchan->agrp_index= 0;
00834             else if (pchan->agrp_index > pose->active_group)
00835                 pchan->agrp_index--;
00836         }
00837         
00838         /* now, remove it from the pose */
00839         BLI_freelinkN(&pose->agroups, grp);
00840         pose->active_group--;
00841         if (pose->active_group < 0 || pose->agroups.first == NULL) {
00842             pose->active_group= 0;
00843         }
00844     }
00845 }
00846 
00847 /* ************** F-Curve Utilities for Actions ****************** */
00848 
00849 /* Check if the given action has any keyframes */
00850 short action_has_motion(const bAction *act)
00851 {
00852     FCurve *fcu;
00853     
00854     /* return on the first F-Curve that has some keyframes/samples defined */
00855     if (act) {
00856         for (fcu= act->curves.first; fcu; fcu= fcu->next) {
00857             if (fcu->totvert)
00858                 return 1;
00859         }
00860     }
00861     
00862     /* nothing found */
00863     return 0;
00864 }
00865 
00866 /* Calculate the extents of given action */
00867 void calc_action_range(const bAction *act, float *start, float *end, short incl_modifiers)
00868 {
00869     FCurve *fcu;
00870     float min=999999999.0f, max=-999999999.0f;
00871     short foundvert=0, foundmod=0;
00872 
00873     if (act) {
00874         for (fcu= act->curves.first; fcu; fcu= fcu->next) {
00875             /* if curve has keyframes, consider them first */
00876             if (fcu->totvert) {
00877                 float nmin, nmax;
00878                 
00879                 /* get extents for this curve */
00880                 // TODO: allow enabling/disabling this?
00881                 calc_fcurve_range(fcu, &nmin, &nmax, FALSE, TRUE);
00882                 
00883                 /* compare to the running tally */
00884                 min= MIN2(min, nmin);
00885                 max= MAX2(max, nmax);
00886                 
00887                 foundvert= 1;
00888             }
00889             
00890             /* if incl_modifiers is enabled, need to consider modifiers too
00891              *  - only really care about the last modifier
00892              */
00893             if ((incl_modifiers) && (fcu->modifiers.last)) {
00894                 FModifier *fcm= fcu->modifiers.last;
00895                 
00896                 /* only use the maximum sensible limits of the modifiers if they are more extreme */
00897                 switch (fcm->type) {
00898                     case FMODIFIER_TYPE_LIMITS: /* Limits F-Modifier */
00899                     {
00900                         FMod_Limits *fmd= (FMod_Limits *)fcm->data;
00901                         
00902                         if (fmd->flag & FCM_LIMIT_XMIN) {
00903                             min= MIN2(min, fmd->rect.xmin);
00904                         }
00905                         if (fmd->flag & FCM_LIMIT_XMAX) {
00906                             max= MAX2(max, fmd->rect.xmax);
00907                         }
00908                     }
00909                         break;
00910                         
00911                     case FMODIFIER_TYPE_CYCLES: /* Cycles F-Modifier */
00912                     {
00913                         FMod_Cycles *fmd= (FMod_Cycles *)fcm->data;
00914                         
00915                         if (fmd->before_mode != FCM_EXTRAPOLATE_NONE)
00916                             min= MINAFRAMEF;
00917                         if (fmd->after_mode != FCM_EXTRAPOLATE_NONE)
00918                             max= MAXFRAMEF;
00919                     }
00920                         break;
00921                         
00922                     // TODO: function modifier may need some special limits
00923                         
00924                     default: /* all other standard modifiers are on the infinite range... */
00925                         min= MINAFRAMEF;
00926                         max= MAXFRAMEF;
00927                         break;
00928                 }
00929                 
00930                 foundmod= 1;
00931             }
00932         }
00933     }   
00934     
00935     if (foundvert || foundmod) {
00936         if (min==max) max+= 1.0f;
00937         *start= min;
00938         *end= max;
00939     }
00940     else {
00941         *start= 0.0f;
00942         *end= 1.0f;
00943     }
00944 }
00945 
00946 /* Return flags indicating which transforms the given object/posechannel has 
00947  *  - if 'curves' is provided, a list of links to these curves are also returned
00948  */
00949 short action_get_item_transforms (bAction *act, Object *ob, bPoseChannel *pchan, ListBase *curves)
00950 {
00951     PointerRNA ptr;
00952     FCurve *fcu;
00953     char *basePath=NULL;
00954     short flags=0;
00955     
00956     /* build PointerRNA from provided data to obtain the paths to use */
00957     if (pchan)
00958         RNA_pointer_create((ID *)ob, &RNA_PoseBone, pchan, &ptr);
00959     else if (ob)
00960         RNA_id_pointer_create((ID *)ob, &ptr);
00961     else    
00962         return 0;
00963         
00964     /* get the basic path to the properties of interest */
00965     basePath= RNA_path_from_ID_to_struct(&ptr);
00966     if (basePath == NULL)
00967         return 0;
00968         
00969     /* search F-Curves for the given properties 
00970      *  - we cannot use the groups, since they may not be grouped in that way...
00971      */
00972     for (fcu= act->curves.first; fcu; fcu= fcu->next) {
00973         char *bPtr=NULL, *pPtr=NULL;
00974         
00975         /* if enough flags have been found, we can stop checking unless we're also getting the curves */
00976         if ((flags == ACT_TRANS_ALL) && (curves == NULL))
00977             break;
00978             
00979         /* just in case... */
00980         if (fcu->rna_path == NULL)
00981             continue;
00982         
00983         /* step 1: check for matching base path */
00984         bPtr= strstr(fcu->rna_path, basePath);
00985         
00986         if (bPtr) {
00987             /* we must add len(basePath) bytes to the match so that we are at the end of the 
00988              * base path so that we don't get false positives with these strings in the names
00989              */
00990             bPtr += strlen(basePath);
00991             
00992             /* step 2: check for some property with transforms 
00993              *  - to speed things up, only check for the ones not yet found 
00994              *    unless we're getting the curves too
00995              *  - if we're getting the curves, the BLI_genericNodeN() creates a LinkData
00996              *    node wrapping the F-Curve, which then gets added to the list
00997              *  - once a match has been found, the curve cannot possibly be any other one
00998              */
00999             if ((curves) || (flags & ACT_TRANS_LOC) == 0) {
01000                 pPtr= strstr(bPtr, "location");
01001                 if (pPtr) {
01002                     flags |= ACT_TRANS_LOC;
01003                     
01004                     if (curves) 
01005                         BLI_addtail(curves, BLI_genericNodeN(fcu));
01006                     continue;
01007                 }
01008             }
01009             
01010             if ((curves) || (flags & ACT_TRANS_SCALE) == 0) {
01011                 pPtr= strstr(bPtr, "scale");
01012                 if (pPtr) {
01013                     flags |= ACT_TRANS_SCALE;
01014                     
01015                     if (curves) 
01016                         BLI_addtail(curves, BLI_genericNodeN(fcu));
01017                     continue;
01018                 }
01019             }
01020             
01021             if ((curves) || (flags & ACT_TRANS_ROT) == 0) {
01022                 pPtr= strstr(bPtr, "rotation");
01023                 if (pPtr) {
01024                     flags |= ACT_TRANS_ROT;
01025                     
01026                     if (curves) 
01027                         BLI_addtail(curves, BLI_genericNodeN(fcu));
01028                     continue;
01029                 }
01030             }
01031             
01032             if ((curves) || (flags & ACT_TRANS_PROP) == 0) {
01033                 /* custom properties only */
01034                 pPtr= strstr(bPtr, "[\""); /* extra '"' comment here to keep my texteditor functionlist working :) */  
01035                 if (pPtr) {
01036                     flags |= ACT_TRANS_PROP;
01037                     
01038                     if (curves)
01039                         BLI_addtail(curves, BLI_genericNodeN(fcu));
01040                     continue;
01041                 }
01042             }
01043         }
01044     }
01045     
01046     /* free basePath */
01047     MEM_freeN(basePath);
01048     
01049     /* return flags found */
01050     return flags;
01051 }
01052 
01053 /* ************** Pose Management Tools ****************** */
01054 
01055 /* Copy the data from the action-pose (src) into the pose */
01056 /* both args are assumed to be valid */
01057 /* exported to game engine */
01058 /* Note! this assumes both poses are aligned, this isn't always true when dealing with user poses */
01059 void extract_pose_from_pose(bPose *pose, const bPose *src)
01060 {
01061     const bPoseChannel *schan;
01062     bPoseChannel *pchan= pose->chanbase.first;
01063 
01064     if (pose==src) {
01065         printf("extract_pose_from_pose source and target are the same\n");
01066         return;
01067     }
01068 
01069     for (schan=src->chanbase.first; (schan && pchan); schan=schan->next, pchan= pchan->next) {
01070         copy_pose_channel_data(pchan, schan);
01071     }
01072 }
01073 
01074 /* for do_all_pose_actions, clears the pose. Now also exported for proxy and tools */
01075 void rest_pose(bPose *pose)
01076 {
01077     bPoseChannel *pchan;
01078     
01079     if (!pose)
01080         return;
01081     
01082     memset(pose->stride_offset, 0, sizeof(pose->stride_offset));
01083     memset(pose->cyclic_offset, 0, sizeof(pose->cyclic_offset));
01084     
01085     for (pchan=pose->chanbase.first; pchan; pchan= pchan->next) {
01086         zero_v3(pchan->loc);
01087         zero_v3(pchan->eul);
01088         unit_qt(pchan->quat);
01089         unit_axis_angle(pchan->rotAxis, &pchan->rotAngle);
01090         pchan->size[0]= pchan->size[1]= pchan->size[2]= 1.0f;
01091 
01092         pchan->flag &= ~(POSE_LOC|POSE_ROT|POSE_SIZE);
01093     }
01094 }
01095 
01096 /* both poses should be in sync */
01097 void copy_pose_result(bPose *to, bPose *from)
01098 {
01099     bPoseChannel *pchanto, *pchanfrom;
01100     
01101     if (to==NULL || from==NULL) {
01102         printf("pose result copy error to:%p from:%p\n", (void *)to, (void *)from); // debug temp
01103         return;
01104     }
01105 
01106     if (to==from) {
01107         printf("copy_pose_result source and target are the same\n");
01108         return;
01109     }
01110 
01111 
01112     for (pchanfrom= from->chanbase.first; pchanfrom; pchanfrom= pchanfrom->next) {
01113         pchanto= get_pose_channel(to, pchanfrom->name);
01114         if (pchanto) {
01115             copy_m4_m4(pchanto->pose_mat, pchanfrom->pose_mat);
01116             copy_m4_m4(pchanto->chan_mat, pchanfrom->chan_mat);
01117             
01118             /* used for local constraints */
01119             copy_v3_v3(pchanto->loc, pchanfrom->loc);
01120             copy_qt_qt(pchanto->quat, pchanfrom->quat);
01121             copy_v3_v3(pchanto->eul, pchanfrom->eul);
01122             copy_v3_v3(pchanto->size, pchanfrom->size);
01123             
01124             copy_v3_v3(pchanto->pose_head, pchanfrom->pose_head);
01125             copy_v3_v3(pchanto->pose_tail, pchanfrom->pose_tail);
01126             
01127             pchanto->rotmode= pchanfrom->rotmode;
01128             pchanto->flag= pchanfrom->flag;
01129             pchanto->protectflag= pchanfrom->protectflag;
01130         }
01131     }
01132 }
01133 
01134 /* For the calculation of the effects of an Action at the given frame on an object 
01135  * This is currently only used for the Action Constraint 
01136  */
01137 void what_does_obaction (Object *ob, Object *workob, bPose *pose, bAction *act, char groupname[], float cframe)
01138 {
01139     bActionGroup *agrp= action_groups_find_named(act, groupname);
01140     
01141     /* clear workob */
01142     clear_workob(workob);
01143     
01144     /* init workob */
01145     copy_m4_m4(workob->obmat, ob->obmat);
01146     copy_m4_m4(workob->parentinv, ob->parentinv);
01147     copy_m4_m4(workob->constinv, ob->constinv);
01148     workob->parent= ob->parent;
01149     
01150     workob->rotmode= ob->rotmode;
01151     
01152     workob->trackflag= ob->trackflag;
01153     workob->upflag= ob->upflag;
01154     
01155     workob->partype= ob->partype;
01156     workob->par1= ob->par1;
01157     workob->par2= ob->par2;
01158     workob->par3= ob->par3;
01159 
01160     workob->constraints.first = ob->constraints.first;
01161     workob->constraints.last = ob->constraints.last;
01162     
01163     workob->pose= pose; /* need to set pose too, since this is used for both types of Action Constraint */
01164 
01165     BLI_strncpy(workob->parsubstr, ob->parsubstr, sizeof(workob->parsubstr));
01166     BLI_strncpy(workob->id.name, "OB<ConstrWorkOb>", sizeof(workob->id.name)); /* we don't use real object name, otherwise RNA screws with the real thing */
01167     
01168     /* if we're given a group to use, it's likely to be more efficient (though a bit more dangerous) */
01169     if (agrp) {
01170         /* specifically evaluate this group only */
01171         PointerRNA id_ptr;
01172         
01173         /* get RNA-pointer for the workob's ID */
01174         RNA_id_pointer_create(&workob->id, &id_ptr);
01175         
01176         /* execute action for this group only */
01177         animsys_evaluate_action_group(&id_ptr, act, agrp, NULL, cframe);
01178     }
01179     else {
01180         AnimData adt= {NULL};
01181         
01182         /* init animdata, and attach to workob */
01183         workob->adt= &adt;
01184         
01185         adt.recalc= ADT_RECALC_ANIM;
01186         adt.action= act;
01187         
01188         /* execute effects of Action on to workob (or it's PoseChannels) */
01189         BKE_animsys_evaluate_animdata(NULL, &workob->id, &adt, cframe, ADT_RECALC_ANIM);
01190     }
01191 }
01192 
01193 /* ********** NLA with non-poses works with ipo channels ********** */
01194 
01195 #if 0 // XXX OLD ANIMATION SYSTEM (TO BE REMOVED)
01196 
01197 /* ************************ Blending with NLA *************** */
01198 
01199 static void blend_pose_strides(bPose *dst, bPose *src, float srcweight, short mode)
01200 {
01201     float dstweight;
01202     
01203     switch (mode) {
01204         case ACTSTRIPMODE_BLEND:
01205             dstweight = 1.0F - srcweight;
01206             break;
01207         case ACTSTRIPMODE_ADD:
01208             dstweight = 1.0F;
01209             break;
01210         default :
01211             dstweight = 1.0F;
01212     }
01213     
01214     interp_v3_v3v3(dst->stride_offset, dst->stride_offset, src->stride_offset, srcweight);
01215 }
01216 
01217 
01218 /*
01219  * bone matching diagram, strips A and B
01220  * 
01221  *                  .------------------------.
01222  *                  |         A              |
01223  *                  '------------------------'
01224  *                  .          .             b2
01225  *                  .          .-------------v----------.
01226  *                  .          |         B   .          |
01227  *                  .          '------------------------'
01228  *                  .          .             .
01229  *                  .          .             .
01230  * offset:          .    0     .    A-B      .  A-b2+B
01231  *                  .          .             .
01232  *
01233  * */
01234 
01235 
01236 static void blend_pose_offset_bone(bActionStrip *strip, bPose *dst, bPose *src, float srcweight, short mode)
01237 {
01238     /* matching offset bones */
01239     /* take dst offset, and put src on on that location */
01240     
01241     if (strip->offs_bone[0]==0)
01242         return;
01243     
01244     /* are we also blending with matching bones? */
01245     if (strip->prev && strip->start>=strip->prev->start) {
01246         bPoseChannel *dpchan= get_pose_channel(dst, strip->offs_bone);
01247         if (dpchan) {
01248             bPoseChannel *spchan= get_pose_channel(src, strip->offs_bone);
01249             if (spchan) {
01250                 float vec[3];
01251                 
01252                 /* dst->ctime has the internal strip->prev action time */
01253                 /* map this time to nla time */
01254                 
01255                 float ctime= get_actionstrip_frame(strip, src->ctime, 1);
01256                 
01257                 if ( ctime > strip->prev->end) {
01258                     bActionChannel *achan;
01259                     
01260                     /* add src to dest, minus the position of src on strip->prev->end */
01261                     
01262                     ctime= get_actionstrip_frame(strip, strip->prev->end, 0);
01263                     
01264                     achan= get_action_channel(strip->act, strip->offs_bone);
01265                     if (achan && achan->ipo) {
01266                         bPoseChannel pchan;
01267                         /* Evaluates and sets the internal ipo value */
01268                         calc_ipo(achan->ipo, ctime);
01269                         /* This call also sets the pchan flags */
01270                         execute_action_ipo(achan, &pchan);
01271                         
01272                         /* store offset that moves src to location of pchan */
01273                         sub_v3_v3v3(vec, dpchan->loc, pchan.loc);
01274                         
01275                         mul_mat3_m4_v3(dpchan->bone->arm_mat, vec);
01276                     }
01277                 }
01278                 else {
01279                     /* store offset that moves src to location of dst */
01280                     
01281                     sub_v3_v3v3(vec, dpchan->loc, spchan->loc);
01282                     mul_mat3_m4_v3(dpchan->bone->arm_mat, vec);
01283                 }
01284                 
01285                 /* if blending, we only add with factor scrweight */
01286                 mul_v3_fl(vec, srcweight);
01287                 
01288                 add_v3_v3(dst->cyclic_offset, vec);
01289             }
01290         }
01291     }
01292     
01293     add_v3_v3(dst->cyclic_offset, src->cyclic_offset);
01294 }
01295 
01296 /* added "sizecorr" here, to allow armatures to be scaled and still have striding.
01297  * Only works for uniform scaling. In general I'd advise against scaling armatures ever though! (ton)
01298  */
01299 static float stridechannel_frame(Object *ob, float sizecorr, bActionStrip *strip, Path *path, float pathdist, float *stride_offset)
01300 {
01301     bAction *act= strip->act;
01302     const char *name= strip->stridechannel;
01303     bActionChannel *achan= get_action_channel(act, name);
01304     int stride_axis= strip->stride_axis;
01305 
01306     if (achan && achan->ipo) {
01307         IpoCurve *icu= NULL;
01308         float minx=0.0f, maxx=0.0f, miny=0.0f, maxy=0.0f;
01309         int foundvert= 0;
01310         
01311         if (stride_axis==0) stride_axis= AC_LOC_X;
01312         else if (stride_axis==1) stride_axis= AC_LOC_Y;
01313         else stride_axis= AC_LOC_Z;
01314         
01315         /* calculate the min/max */
01316         for (icu=achan->ipo->curve.first; icu; icu=icu->next) {
01317             if (icu->adrcode==stride_axis) {
01318                 if (icu->totvert>1) {
01319                     foundvert= 1;
01320                     minx= icu->bezt[0].vec[1][0];
01321                     maxx= icu->bezt[icu->totvert-1].vec[1][0];
01322                     
01323                     miny= icu->bezt[0].vec[1][1];
01324                     maxy= icu->bezt[icu->totvert-1].vec[1][1];
01325                 }
01326                 break;
01327             }
01328         }
01329         
01330         if (foundvert && miny!=maxy) {
01331             float stridelen= sizecorr*fabs(maxy-miny), striptime;
01332             float actiondist, pdist, pdistNewNormalized, offs;
01333             float vec1[4], vec2[4], dir[3];
01334             
01335             /* internal cycling, actoffs is in frames */
01336             offs= stridelen*strip->actoffs/(maxx-minx);
01337             
01338             /* amount path moves object */
01339             pdist = (float)fmod (pathdist+offs, stridelen);
01340             striptime= pdist/stridelen;
01341             
01342             /* amount stride bone moves */
01343             actiondist= sizecorr*eval_icu(icu, minx + striptime*(maxx-minx)) - miny;
01344             
01345             pdist = fabs(actiondist) - pdist;
01346             pdistNewNormalized = (pathdist+pdist)/path->totdist;
01347             
01348             /* now we need to go pdist further (or less) on cu path */
01349             where_on_path(ob, (pathdist)/path->totdist, vec1, dir); /* vec needs size 4 */
01350             if (pdistNewNormalized <= 1) {
01351                 // search for correction in positive path-direction
01352                 where_on_path(ob, pdistNewNormalized, vec2, dir);   /* vec needs size 4 */
01353                 sub_v3_v3v3(stride_offset, vec2, vec1);
01354             }
01355             else {
01356                 // we reached the end of the path, search backwards instead
01357                 where_on_path(ob, (pathdist-pdist)/path->totdist, vec2, dir);   /* vec needs size 4 */
01358                 sub_v3_v3v3(stride_offset, vec1, vec2);
01359             }
01360             mul_mat3_m4_v3(ob->obmat, stride_offset);
01361             return striptime;
01362         }
01363     }
01364     return 0.0f;
01365 }
01366 
01367 static void cyclic_offs_bone(Object *ob, bPose *pose, bActionStrip *strip, float time)
01368 {
01369     /* only called when strip has cyclic, so >= 1.0f works... */
01370     if (time >= 1.0f) {
01371         bActionChannel *achan= get_action_channel(strip->act, strip->offs_bone);
01372 
01373         if (achan && achan->ipo) {
01374             IpoCurve *icu= NULL;
01375             Bone *bone;
01376             float min[3]={0.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f}, max[3]={0.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f};
01377             int index=0, foundvert= 0;
01378             
01379             /* calculate the min/max */
01380             for (icu=achan->ipo->curve.first; icu; icu=icu->next) {
01381                 if (icu->totvert>1) {
01382                     
01383                     if (icu->adrcode==AC_LOC_X)
01384                         index= 0;
01385                     else if (icu->adrcode==AC_LOC_Y)
01386                         index= 1;
01387                     else if (icu->adrcode==AC_LOC_Z)
01388                         index= 2;
01389                     else
01390                         continue;
01391                 
01392                     foundvert= 1;
01393                     min[index]= icu->bezt[0].vec[1][1];
01394                     max[index]= icu->bezt[icu->totvert-1].vec[1][1];
01395                 }
01396             }
01397             if (foundvert) {
01398                 /* bring it into armature space */
01399                 sub_v3_v3v3(min, max, min);
01400                 bone= get_named_bone(ob->data, strip->offs_bone);   /* weak */
01401                 if (bone) {
01402                     mul_mat3_m4_v3(bone->arm_mat, min);
01403                     
01404                     /* dominant motion, cyclic_offset was cleared in rest_pose */
01405                     if (strip->flag & (ACTSTRIP_CYCLIC_USEX | ACTSTRIP_CYCLIC_USEY | ACTSTRIP_CYCLIC_USEZ)) {
01406                         if (strip->flag & ACTSTRIP_CYCLIC_USEX) pose->cyclic_offset[0]= time*min[0];
01407                         if (strip->flag & ACTSTRIP_CYCLIC_USEY) pose->cyclic_offset[1]= time*min[1];
01408                         if (strip->flag & ACTSTRIP_CYCLIC_USEZ) pose->cyclic_offset[2]= time*min[2];
01409                     }
01410                     else {
01411                         if ( fabs(min[0]) >= fabs(min[1]) && fabs(min[0]) >= fabs(min[2]))
01412                             pose->cyclic_offset[0]= time*min[0];
01413                         else if ( fabs(min[1]) >= fabs(min[0]) && fabs(min[1]) >= fabs(min[2]))
01414                             pose->cyclic_offset[1]= time*min[1];
01415                         else
01416                             pose->cyclic_offset[2]= time*min[2];
01417                     }
01418                 }
01419             }
01420         }
01421     }
01422 }
01423 
01424 /* simple case for now; only the curve path with constraint value > 0.5 */
01425 /* blending we might do later... */
01426 static Object *get_parent_path(Object *ob)
01427 {
01428     bConstraint *con;
01429     
01430     if (ob->parent && ob->parent->type==OB_CURVE)
01431         return ob->parent;
01432     
01433     for (con = ob->constraints.first; con; con=con->next) {
01434         if (con->type==CONSTRAINT_TYPE_FOLLOWPATH) {
01435             if (con->enforce>0.5f) {
01436                 bFollowPathConstraint *data= con->data;
01437                 return data->tar;
01438             }
01439         }
01440     }
01441     return NULL;
01442 }
01443 
01444 /* ************** do the action ************ */
01445 
01446 /* ----- nla, etc. --------- */
01447 
01448 static void do_nla(Scene *scene, Object *ob, int blocktype)
01449 {
01450     bPose *tpose= NULL;
01451     Key *key= NULL;
01452     ListBase tchanbase={NULL, NULL}, chanbase={NULL, NULL};
01453     bActionStrip *strip, *striplast=NULL, *stripfirst=NULL;
01454     float striptime, frametime, length, actlength;
01455     float blendfac, stripframe;
01456     float scene_cfra= BKE_curframe(scene);
01457     int doit, dostride;
01458     
01459     if (blocktype==ID_AR) {
01460         copy_pose(&tpose, ob->pose, 1);
01461         rest_pose(ob->pose);        // potentially destroying current not-keyed pose
01462     }
01463     else {
01464         key= ob_get_key(ob);
01465     }
01466     
01467     /* check on extend to left or right, when no strip is hit by 'cfra' */
01468     for (strip=ob->nlastrips.first; strip; strip=strip->next) {
01469         /* escape loop on a hit */
01470         if ( scene_cfra >= strip->start && scene_cfra <= strip->end + 0.1f) /* note 0.1 comes back below */
01471             break;
01472         if (scene_cfra < strip->start) {
01473             if (stripfirst==NULL)
01474                 stripfirst= strip;
01475             else if (stripfirst->start > strip->start)
01476                 stripfirst= strip;
01477         }
01478         else if (scene_cfra > strip->end) {
01479             if (striplast==NULL)
01480                 striplast= strip;
01481             else if (striplast->end < strip->end)
01482                 striplast= strip;
01483         }
01484     }
01485     if (strip==NULL) {  /* extend */
01486         if (striplast)
01487             scene_cfra= striplast->end;
01488         else if (stripfirst)
01489             scene_cfra= stripfirst->start;
01490     }
01491     
01492     /* and now go over all strips */
01493     for (strip=ob->nlastrips.first; strip; strip=strip->next) {
01494         doit=dostride= 0;
01495         
01496         if (strip->act && !(strip->flag & ACTSTRIP_MUTE)) { /* so theres an action */
01497             
01498             /* Determine if the current frame is within the strip's range */
01499             length = strip->end-strip->start;
01500             actlength = strip->actend-strip->actstart;
01501             striptime = (scene_cfra - strip->start) / length;
01502             stripframe = (scene_cfra - strip->start);
01503 
01504             if (striptime>=0.0) {
01505                 
01506                 if (blocktype==ID_AR) 
01507                     rest_pose(tpose);
01508                 
01509                 /* To handle repeat, we add 0.1 frame extra to make sure the last frame is included */
01510                 if (striptime < 1.0f + 0.1f/length) {
01511                     
01512                     /* Handle path */
01513                     if ((strip->flag & ACTSTRIP_USESTRIDE) && (blocktype==ID_AR) && (ob->ipoflag & OB_DISABLE_PATH)==0) {
01514                         Object *parent= get_parent_path(ob);
01515                         
01516                         if (parent) {
01517                             Curve *cu = parent->data;
01518                             float ctime, pdist;
01519                             
01520                             if (cu->flag & CU_PATH) {
01521                                 /* Ensure we have a valid path */
01522                                 if (cu->path==NULL || cu->path->data==NULL) makeDispListCurveTypes(scene, parent, 0);
01523                                 if (cu->path) {
01524                                     
01525                                     /* Find the position on the path */
01526                                     ctime= bsystem_time(scene, ob, scene_cfra, 0.0);
01527                                     
01528                                     if (calc_ipo_spec(cu->ipo, CU_SPEED, &ctime)==0) {
01529                                         /* correct for actions not starting on zero */
01530                                         ctime= (ctime - strip->actstart)/cu->pathlen;
01531                                         CLAMP(ctime, 0.0, 1.0);
01532                                     }
01533                                     pdist = ctime*cu->path->totdist;
01534                                     
01535                                     if (tpose && strip->stridechannel[0]) {
01536                                         striptime= stridechannel_frame(parent, ob->size[0], strip, cu->path, pdist, tpose->stride_offset);
01537                                     }                                   
01538                                     else {
01539                                         if (strip->stridelen) {
01540                                             striptime = pdist / strip->stridelen;
01541                                             striptime = (float)fmod (striptime+strip->actoffs, 1.0);
01542                                         }
01543                                         else
01544                                             striptime = 0;
01545                                     }
01546                                     
01547                                     frametime = (striptime * actlength) + strip->actstart;
01548                                     frametime= bsystem_time(scene, ob, frametime, 0.0);
01549                                     
01550                                     if (blocktype==ID_AR) {
01551                                         extract_pose_from_action (tpose, strip->act, frametime);
01552                                     }
01553                                     else if (blocktype==ID_OB) {
01554                                         extract_ipochannels_from_action(&tchanbase, &ob->id, strip->act, "Object", frametime);
01555                                         if (key)
01556                                             extract_ipochannels_from_action(&tchanbase, &key->id, strip->act, "Shape", frametime);
01557                                     }
01558                                     doit=dostride= 1;
01559                                 }
01560                             }
01561                         }
01562                     }
01563                     /* To handle repeat, we add 0.1 frame extra to make sure the last frame is included */
01564                     else {
01565                         
01566                         /* Mod to repeat */
01567                         if (strip->repeat!=1.0f) {
01568                             float cycle= striptime*strip->repeat;
01569                             
01570                             striptime = (float)fmod (cycle, 1.0f + 0.1f/length);
01571                             cycle-= striptime;
01572                             
01573                             if (blocktype==ID_AR)
01574                                 cyclic_offs_bone(ob, tpose, strip, cycle);
01575                         }
01576 
01577                         frametime = (striptime * actlength) + strip->actstart;
01578                         frametime= nla_time(scene, frametime, (float)strip->repeat);
01579                             
01580                         if (blocktype==ID_AR) {
01581                             extract_pose_from_action (tpose, strip->act, frametime);
01582                         }
01583                         else if (blocktype==ID_OB) {
01584                             extract_ipochannels_from_action(&tchanbase, &ob->id, strip->act, "Object", frametime);
01585                             if (key)
01586                                 extract_ipochannels_from_action(&tchanbase, &key->id, strip->act, "Shape", frametime);
01587                         }
01588                         
01589                         doit=1;
01590                     }
01591                 }
01592                 /* Handle extend */
01593                 else {
01594                     if (strip->flag & ACTSTRIP_HOLDLASTFRAME) {
01595                         /* we want the strip to hold on the exact fraction of the repeat value */
01596                         
01597                         frametime = actlength * (strip->repeat-(int)strip->repeat);
01598                         if (frametime<=0.000001f) frametime= actlength; /* rounding errors... */
01599                         frametime= bsystem_time(scene, ob, frametime+strip->actstart, 0.0);
01600                         
01601                         if (blocktype==ID_AR)
01602                             extract_pose_from_action (tpose, strip->act, frametime);
01603                         else if (blocktype==ID_OB) {
01604                             extract_ipochannels_from_action(&tchanbase, &ob->id, strip->act, "Object", frametime);
01605                             if (key)
01606                                 extract_ipochannels_from_action(&tchanbase, &key->id, strip->act, "Shape", frametime);
01607                         }
01608                         
01609                         /* handle cycle hold */
01610                         if (strip->repeat!=1.0f) {
01611                             if (blocktype==ID_AR)
01612                                 cyclic_offs_bone(ob, tpose, strip, strip->repeat-1.0f);
01613                         }
01614                         
01615                         doit=1;
01616                     }
01617                 }
01618                 
01619                 /* Handle blendin & blendout */
01620                 if (doit) {
01621                     /* Handle blendin */
01622                     
01623                     if (strip->blendin>0.0 && stripframe<=strip->blendin && scene_cfra>=strip->start) {
01624                         blendfac = stripframe/strip->blendin;
01625                     }
01626                     else if (strip->blendout>0.0 && stripframe>=(length-strip->blendout) && scene_cfra<=strip->end) {
01627                         blendfac = (length-stripframe)/(strip->blendout);
01628                     }
01629                     else
01630                         blendfac = 1;
01631                     
01632                     if (blocktype==ID_AR) {/* Blend this pose with the accumulated pose */
01633                         /* offset bone, for matching cycles */
01634                         blend_pose_offset_bone (strip, ob->pose, tpose, blendfac, strip->mode);
01635                         
01636                         blend_poses (ob->pose, tpose, blendfac, strip->mode);
01637                         if (dostride)
01638                             blend_pose_strides (ob->pose, tpose, blendfac, strip->mode);
01639                     }
01640                     else {
01641                         blend_ipochannels(&chanbase, &tchanbase, blendfac, strip->mode);
01642                         BLI_freelistN(&tchanbase);
01643                     }
01644                 }
01645             }                   
01646         }
01647     }
01648     
01649     if (blocktype==ID_OB) {
01650         execute_ipochannels(&chanbase);
01651     }
01652     else if (blocktype==ID_AR) {
01653         /* apply stride offset to object */
01654         add_v3_v3(ob->obmat[3], ob->pose->stride_offset);
01655     }
01656     
01657     /* free */
01658     if (tpose)
01659         free_pose(tpose);
01660     if (chanbase.first)
01661         BLI_freelistN(&chanbase);
01662 }
01663
